thread.title: Charlotte Casiraghi Easy Side Sweep and Red Lip Stain Bring the Gucci Girl Down to Earth
thread.title_full: Charlotte Casiraghi Easy Side Sweep and Red Lip Stain Bring the Gucci Girl Down to Earth

title: Charlotte Casiraghi Easy Side Sweep and Red Lip Stain Bring the Gucci Girl Down to Earth

organizations.name: earth how charlotte casiraghi brings royal polish to gucci

text: How Charlotte Casiraghi Brings Royal Polish to Gucci’s Front Row  16 PM by Sophie Schulte-Hillen Photo: Getty Images As Alessandro Michele ’s kaleidoscopic procession of madcap romantics descended down the Gucci runway in what is sure to go down as one of Milan Fashion Week ’s most inspired collections, Charlotte Casiraghi brought a dose of regal cool-girl polish to the front row. The Monegasque beauty balanced a quirky outfit of gold sequins and bottle green denim with a restrained beauty equation that let her royally good looks (her mother is Princess Caroline of Monaco; her grandmother was Grace Kelly) take center stage. Her shoulder-length brown hair was blown out into a simple side-sweep with just a hint of bend at the ends, a brilliantly simple style that felt even fresher with the help of a pressed-on matte red lip stain, a swirl of bright pink blush, and a flick of black eye pencil–all framed by that famous set of brushed-up power brows. It’s a look that took Gucci’s whimsical designs into sporty territory, aligning neatly with her role as official equestrian ambassador whose custom outfits (alas, not for sale) at show jumping competitions breathe new life into the horse-bit motif that’s threaded through the house’s history. A collision of old and new guard? Only in the best way. Because if there was one lesson to be gleaned from the runway today it’s this: Whatever makes you happy.
